2018/KER/238
IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT:
THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.SUDHEENDRA KUMAR
THURSDAY, THE 4TH DAY OF JANUARY 2018 / 14TH POUSHA, 1939
Crl.MC.No. 918 of 2016
Cc 1071/2005 of J.M.F.C.-I, PUNALUR

PETITIONER (S) /ACCUSED

T.UMMEN PANICKER

TOPS MANOR, PANAVELI P.O., KOTTARAKKARA.

BY ADV.SRI.R.V.SREEJITH

RESPONDENT (S)/STATE & COMPLAINANT:
1. STATE OF KERALA

REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR,

OFFICE OF THE ADVOCATE GENERAL,

HIGH COURT OF KERALA.
2. I.PRASAD

S/O.K.K.ITTI CHERIYA, KALAPPILA HOUSE,

EDAMULAKKAL VILLAGE, ANCHAL, KOLLAM DISTRICT.

PIN - 691 306.

BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI. E.C. BINEESH
THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON

04-01-2018,THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

Rape

APPENDIX
PETITIONER (S)' EXHIBITS
ANNEXURE-Al: CERTIFIED COPY OF THE COMPLAINT IN
C.Cc. NO.1071/2005 ON THE FILE OF THE JUDICIAL FIRST
CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT-I, PUNALUR.
ANNEXURE-A2: TRUE COPY OF THE INDEMNITY BOND
EXECUTED BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT HEREIN AND HIS
BROTHER I.NOBLE DATED 29.6.2012
ANNEXURE-A3: TRUE COPY OF CHEQUE BEARING NO.551366
DATED 3.10.2005 OF FEDERAL BANK, KALAYAPURAM
BRANCH.
/TRUE COPY/
P.S. TO JUDGE

Bt
2018/KER/238
B. SUDHEENDRA KUMAR, J.
Crl.M.C. No. 918 of 2016
Dated this the 4 day of January, 2018
ORDER

The petitioner is the accused in L.P. No. 62 of 2008
on the files of the court below. The above case arose out of
Annexure-Al complaint filed by the 2"? respondent before
the court below against the petitioner alleging offence
under Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881
(“the N.I.Act” for short).

2. The petitioner has filed this Crl. M.C. praying
for quashing Annexure-Al complaint and _ further
proceedings in the above case.

3. Service is complete. However, there is no
appearance for the 2" respondent. Heard the learned
counsel for the petitioner and the learned Public

Desa
2018/KER/238
-2-
Cri.M.C. No. 918 of 2016
Prosecutor.

4. The learned counsel for the petitioner has
submitted that eventhough the matter was settled between
the parties, the 2"? respondent did not incline to withdraw
Annexure-Al complaint and in the said circumstances, the
petitioner is constrained to approach this Court with the
above Crl. M.C. Annexure-A2 would show that the matter
has been settled between the parties. The petitioner
produced before this Court the original cheque No. 551366
dated 3-10-2005 for Rs. 2,50,000/-, which is the cheque
referred to in Annexure-Al complaint. Since the petitioner
has produced the original cheque before this Court, that
itself would indicate that no successful prosecution against
the petitioner pursuant to Annexure-Al complaint can be
sustained. Therefore, no purpose will be served even if
the prosecution against the petitioner is permitted to be
continued. For the said reason, I am inclined to quash
Annexure-Al complaint and further proceedings against

Bt
pees
2018/KER/238
-3-
Cri.M.C. No. 918 of 2016
the petitioner in L.P No. 62 of 2008 in C.C. No. 1071 of
2005 on the files of the court below in exercise of the
inherent power under Section 482 Cr.P.C., to meet the ends
of justice. It is ordered accordingly.
In the result, this Crl. M.C. stands allowed.
Sd/-B. SUDHEENDRA KUMAR, JUDGE.
